des:
To control the EBO X robot through Alexa voice commands, account linking need to be completed. 
First, the user needs to ensure that the EBO Home app is installed and logged in. 
Second, the robot needs to be bound to the EBO Home app. 
Third, log in to the same Amazon account on the EBO X robot.
The last step is to enable the EBO X Robot Skill.

After completing the above steps, the robot can be controlled to perform convenient and quick actions through voice commands.

In addition, EBO X supports up to 5 robot nicknames for users to choose from, which are: Robot, Guardian, Kitten, Electric Pet, and Smart Companion. Users can modify the nickname of the robot on the Alexa settings page in the EBO Home app.

Taking commanding the robot to stand up as an example, users can switch the robot's nickname and use the following sentence pattern to command the robot to stand up.
"Alexa, set 'Robot' to stand up"
"Alexa, set 'Guardian' to stand up"
"Alexa, set 'Kitten' to stand up"
"Alexa, set 'Electric Pet' to stand up"
"Alexa, set 'Smart Companion' to stand up"

The commands currently supported by the robot are as follows.
"Alexa, set 'Robot' to stand up"
"Alexa, set 'Robot' to sit down"
"Alexa, set 'Robot' to follow me"
"Alexa, set 'Robot' to recharge"

"Alexa, set 'Robot' to freeze"
"Alexa, set 'Robot' to capture smiling face"
